position.marginalia_text: { Totum viri: non dimidium hominis: vt isti vulgares.

marginalia.translation: All of the man, not half of one, like those commoners.
The habit itself of a man.
One and the same, whatever or whoever.

position.marginalia_text: ( Miser homo, cui adhuc discenda è libris Virtus, aut industria.)

marginalia.translation: Miserable is the man for whom virtue and industry must still be learned from books.

position.marginalia_text: Nullus panis, aut vinum tantum alit, quantu[m] panis, vinumq[ue] Sudoris.

marginalia.translation: No bread or wine nourishes as much as the bread or wine of hard labor.

position.marginalia_text: ( Semihominu[m] plenus mundus, id est, nugaru[m].

marginalia.translation: The world is full of half-men, that is, of triflers.

position.marginalia_text: / Purissima aqua uita[e], aqua / Sudoris: ipsa corporis, animiq[ue] quinta essentia.

marginalia.translation: The purest water of life is the water of hard labor, the fifth essence itself of body and mind.

position.marginalia_text: Ego meissimus Tibi tuissimo S[alutem] P[lurimam] D[ico].

marginalia.translation: I very much myself send many greetings to you very much yourself.

position.marginalia_text: Anatom[ia] Singuloru[m], est victoria omnium. Analysis Librorum, est genesis operum.

marginalia.translation: The anatomy of singular men is the victory of all men. The analysis of books is the birth of works.

position.marginalia_text: Bonus animus, et bonum corpus, facilè possunt bonam fortunam.

marginalia.translation: A good mind and a good body can easily make good fortune.

position.marginalia_text: Puerile est, reuerti ad studia puerilia: aut retrogradu[m] esse planeta[m] ad scholastica commenta, quoru[m] vsum nescit mundus.

marginalia.translation: It is childish to turn back to childish studies, or for a star to go backwards to scholastic commentaries, whose usage the world has forgotten.

position.marginalia_text: Miseret me hominis, nescientis Seipsum virum: et Mundum Semihominum. Interim pro se quisq[ue]: Entelechia in suis: Ironia in alienis.

marginalia.translation: I pity the man who does not know that he is a man the world half-man. Nevertheless, each according to his ability: actualization for friends, irony for strangers.
